intro: Viguiera discolor, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viguiera discolor is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
